From: "Tim Magnussen" <tmagnussen@...>

Hi there. I'm quite new to JUnit and Java but have used the C++
equivalent for some time.
I'm using JDK 1.3.1 for Linux.
The junit package is downloaded and installed it on my local filesystem.
Two things:
1) The junit documentation tells you to include junit.jar in
CLASSPATH, but apparently javac for 1.3.1 is indifferent to CLASSPATH
and I could only make it work by specifying "javac -classpath
~/blabla/junit.jar".
2)The junit.jar file is apparently compiled especially for JDK 1.2.2 -
alas I could not compile with javac. I found out that "oldjavac" and
"oldjava" did work and so I'm using them instead but this seems like a
wrong way to solve things.

I think all these problems could be solved with a junit.jar that is
compiled for 1.3.1 but haven't been able to find one. Is anyone aware
of a place where one can download this?

Thanks
/Tim
subject: .jar file for JDK 1.3.1
